Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [03_04_2013_B02_3270]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [05_03_2013_E11_605]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.

Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [07_03_2013_G02_873]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [03_04_2013_A10_3165]

Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [06_02_2013_A01_2688280]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.

Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [06_02_2013_C03_2851245]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.

The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [07_03_2013_H02_1114]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.

Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [12_03_2013_B10_2310586]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.

Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [19_03_2013_B04_2027]

Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Title: intensive-care unit patient [21_03_2013_E03_2532]

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.

Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: PAXgene blood RNA tubes were left at room temperaturee to defrost (4 hours) while mixing by inversion.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was collected in PAXgene blood RNA tubes, mixed by inversion 10X and stored at -80C.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated in accordance with the PAXgene blood RNA isolation (QIAGEN) procedure using the QIAcube workstation.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100ng total RNA was labeled using standard GeneChip® 3' IVT Express Kit (Affymetrix)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Standard Affymetrix GeneAtlas® Hybridization, Wash, and Stain Kit.
Sample.Description: blood gene expression data from healthy subjects and critically-ill patients.
Sample.Data-Processing: Raw data scans (.CEL files) were read into the R language and environment for statistical computing (version 2.15.1; R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria; http://www.R-project.org/). Pre-processing and quality control was performed by using the Affy package version 1.36.1. Array data were background corrected by Robust Multi-array Average, quantiles-normalized and summarized by medianpolish using the expresso function. The resultant 49,386 probe intensities were filtered by means of a 0.5 variance cutoff using the genefilter method to recover 24,646 expressed probes. The occurrence of non-experimental chip effects was evaluated by means of the Surrogate Variable Analysis (R package version 3.4.0) and corrected by the empirical Bayes method ComBat.

Series.Title: Genome-wide blood transcriptional profiling in critically ill patients - MARS consortium
Series.Summary: The host response in critically ill patients with sepsis, septic shock remains poorly defined. Considerable research has been conducted to accurately distinguish patients with sepsis from those with non-infectious causes of disease. Technological innovations have positioned systems biology at the forefront of biomarker discovery. Analysis of the whole-blood leukocyte transcriptome enables the assessment of thousands of molecular signals beyond simply measuring several proteins in plasma, which for use as biomarkers is important since combinations of biomarkers likely provide more diagnostic accuracy than the measurement of single ones or a few. Evidence suggests that genome-wide transcriptional profiling of blood leukocytes can assist in differentiating between infection and non-infectious causes of severe disease. Of importance, RNA biomarkers have the potential advantage that they can be measured reliably in rapid quantitative reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR)-based point of care tests.
Series.Overall-Design: PAXgene blood RNA was isolated at intensive-care unit (ICU) admission and throughout ICU length-of-stay. Through the use of genome-wide microarrays we aimed to identify molecular features that enbale the adequate discrimination of infectious and non-infectious sources of critical illness. Patient diagnoses include community-acquired pneumonia (cap), hospital-acquired pneumonia (hap) and non-infectious cap control patients (no-cap) (characteristics: pneumonia diagnoses). The influence of variable degrees of thrombocytopenia were also assessed (characteristics: thrombocytopenia).
